title: Bug 6322: All types dialog displays obfuscated classes prominently
description: In JDK 1.4, the All types dialog displays obfuscated classes like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc., which should be hidden or displayed less prominently.
OB: The obfuscated classes ('a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc.) are prominently visible in the Open Type dialog.
EB: These obfuscated classes should be less prominent or hidden from the Open Type dialog to improve user experience.
SR:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the All types dialog in JDK 1.4.
2. Navigate to the Open Type dialog.
3. Observe the prominence of obfuscated classes like 'a', 'a1', 'b', 'c', 'd', etc.
